mainBoard.flavorText: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.

foreignData.flavorText: Entführer, die in Pfuhlhaven erwischt werden, dürfen sich ihre Strafe aussuchen: im Gefängnis versauern oder Rattenfänger werden. Wer klug ist, geht ins Gefängnis.

foreignData.text: Todesberührung (Eine beliebige Menge Schadenspunkte, die sie einer Kreatur zufügen, sind ausreichend, um diese zu zerstören.)

foreignData.flavorText: Los secuestradores atrapados en Havengul tienen dos opciones: ir a prisión o convertirse en atraparratas. Los inteligentes van a prisión.

foreignData.flavorText: Ai rapitori catturati ad Havengul viene offerto di scegliere: languire in carcere o diventare cacciatori di ratti. I più furbi scelgono il carcere.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

foreignData.flavorText: „Eine herkömmliche Armee verköstigen zu müssen ist eine Frage der Logistik. Bei Zombies ist das eher ein Vorteil. Ihr Hunger ist der Grund, warum sie kämpfen. Ihr Hunger ist der Grund, warum man sie fürchtet." —Jadar, Ghulrufer aus Nefalen
foreignData.name: Wandelnde Leiche

foreignData.flavorText: "La alimentación de un ejército normal supone un problema de logística. Con los zombies, es una ventaja. Su alimentación es aquello por lo que luchan. Su alimentación es aquello por lo que se les teme." —Jadar, llamamuertos de Nephalia
foreignData.name: Cadáver ambulante

foreignData.flavorText: « Nourrir une armée normale revient à résoudre un problème de logistique. Avec des zombies, pas de problème, bien au contraire. Ils combattent pour se nourrir. C'est même pour ça qu'on les redoute. » —Jadar, meneur de goule de Néphalie
foreignData.name: Cadavre ambulant

foreignData.flavorText: "Sfamare un esercito normale è un problema di logistica. Con gli zombie, è un vantaggio. La fame è il motivo per cui combattono. La fame è il motivo per cui sono temuti." —Jadar, evocaghoul di Nephalia
foreignData.name: Cadavere Ambulante

foreignData.flavorText: 「普通の軍隊の場合、食糧確保が問題となる。ゾンビの場合、それが強みになる。奴らは食うために戦い、食うから恐れられる。」 ――ネファリアのグール呼び、ジャダー

foreignData.flavorText: "식량은 일반 부대의 병참술에서는 골치 아픈 문제이지만 좀비를 다룰 때는 중요한 자산이 된다. 식량이야말로 좀비들이 싸우는 이유이며, 적이 그들을 두려워하는 이유이기도 하다." —네팔리아의 악귀소환술사 자다르
foreignData.name: 걸어다니는 시체

foreignData.flavorText: "A alimentação de um exército normal é um problema de logística. A alimentação de zumbis é uma vantagem. Eles lutam para comer. E são temidos por isso." — Jadar, invocador de carniçais de Nefália
foreignData.name: Cadáver Ambulante

foreignData.flavorText: «Для обычной армии пища — это проблема снабжения. Для армии зомби — тактическое преимущество. Их пища — это то, почему они сражаются. Их пища — это то, почему их боятся». — Джадар, призыватель упырей из Нефалии

mainBoard.name: Sultai Scavenger

rulings.text: The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The Jeskai would have me bow in restraint. So I have found a people unafraid of true power."

foreignData.flavorText: „Die Jeskai wollen, dass ich gesenkten Hauptes Zurückhaltung übe. Also habe ich mir ein Volk gesucht, das keine Angst vor wahrer Macht hat."
foreignData.name: Taigams Ränkespiel
foreignData.text: Schaue dir die obersten fünf Karten deiner Bibliothek an. Lege eine beliebige Anzahl davon auf deinen Friedhof und den Rest in beliebiger Reihenfolge oben auf deine Bibliothek.

foreignData.flavorText: "Los Jeskai querrían verme arrodillado y sometido. Veo que he hallado a un pueblo que no teme el auténtico poder".
foreignData.name: Maquinación de Taigam
foreignData.text: Mira las cinco primeras cartas de tu biblioteca. Pon cualquier cantidad de ellas en tu cementerio y el resto en la parte superior de tu biblioteca en cualquier orden.

foreignData.flavorText: « Les Jeskaï m'auraient emprisonné et contraint à me prosterner. Alors j'ai trouvé un peuple qui n'a pas peur de la vraie puissance. »
foreignData.name: Machinations de Taigam
foreignData.text: Regardez les cinq cartes du dessus de votre bibliothèque. Mettez n'importe quel nombre d'entre elles dans votre cimetière et remettez ensuite le reste au-dessus de votre bibliothèque, dans l'ordre de votre choix.

foreignData.flavorText: "I Jeskai vorrebbero che mi piegassi alla moderazione, così ho trovato un popolo che non teme il vero potere."
foreignData.name: Intrighi di Taigam
foreignData.text: Guarda le prime cinque carte del tuo grimorio. Mettine un qualsiasi numero nel tuo cimitero e le altre in cima al tuo grimorio in qualsiasi ordine.

foreignData.flavorText: 「ジェスカイの奴らは私に抑制を教えるために頭を下げさせた。だから、真の力を恐れない者たちを私は探し当てたのさ。」
foreignData.name: テイガムの策謀
foreignData.text: あなたのライブラリーの一番上から５枚のカードを見る。そのうちの望む枚数をあなたの墓地に置き、残りをあなたのライブラリーの一番上に望む順番で置く。

foreignData.flavorText: "제스카이는 나로 하여금 억압된 채로 머리를 숙이게 할 것이야. 그래서 나는 진정한 힘을 두려워하지 않는 이들을 찾았지."

foreignData.flavorText: "Os Jeskai queriam que eu me curvasse em respeito. Então, encontrei um povo que não temesse o poder verdadeiro."

mainBoard.name: Set Adrift

rulings.text: The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.

mainBoard.name: Treasure Cruise

rulings.text: Delve doesn't change a spell's mana cost or mana value. For example, Treasure Cruise's mana value is 8 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.

You can exile cards to pay only for generic mana, and you can't exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can't exile more than seven cards from your graveyard to cast Treasure Cruise unless an effect has increased its cost.
Because delve isn't an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs, such as flashback. It can also be used to pay for additional costs that include generic mana.

mainBoard.name: Dead Drop

rulings.text: Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.
The target player chooses which creatures they will sacrifice as Dead Drop resolves. If the player controls only one creature at that time, they will sacrifice it.
Dead Drop doesn’t target any creature. The target player could sacrifice a creature with hexproof, for example.

The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.

rulings.text: The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.

mainBoard.flavorText: The dense jungle surrenders to a lush and lavish expanse. At its center uncoil the spires of Qarsi Palace.

foreignData.flavorText: Der dichte Dschungel macht einer üppigen, großzügigen Weite Platz. In ihrer Mitte ragen die Turmspitzen des Qarsi-Palasts empor.

foreignData.flavorText: La densa selva deja paso a un claro exuberante y suntuoso. En el centro se alzan los chapiteles del Palacio de Qarsi.
